meanings.definition: To treat (a person or animal) cruelly or with violence.
meanings.sent1: The bully would maltreat the smaller kids on the playground.
meanings.sent2: It is never okay to maltreat animals, they deserve kindness and care.
meanings.sent3: The villain in the movie would always maltreat his loyal henchmen, which made him look even more evil.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to maltreat the fragile ship, tossing it around like a toy in the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The cruel king would maltreat his subjects, causing fear and unrest in the kingdom.

meanings.sent1: Please do not maltreat the fragile package, it may contain something valuable.
meanings.sent2: The workers were instructed not to maltreat the delicate machinery in the factory.
meanings.sent3: Even though it was just a game, he would maltreat the controller in frustration.
meanings.sent4: The old book showed signs of being maltreated over the years, with torn pages and a worn cover.
meanings.sent5: She could see the way he maltreated the tools in the shed, leaving them rusty and broken.
